title: The Golden Goose
sentence: As he entered the wood the same little old man met him  and begged for a piece of cake and a drop of wine  ~newline~ But the second son answered rudely   What I might give to you I shall want myself  so be off   Then he left the little old man standing in the road  and walked on  ~newline~ Then the stupid son said to his father   Let me go for once and cut wood in the forest   But his father said   No  your brothers have been hurt already  and it would be worse for you  who don t understand wood cutting   The boy  however  begged so hard to be allowed to go that his father said   There  get along with you  you will buy your experience very dearly  I expect   There was a man who had three sons  the youngest of whom was considered very silly  and everybody used to mock him and make fun of him  ~newline~ As he entered the forest he met a gray old man  who bade him  Good morning   and said   Give me a little piece of cake out of your basket and a drop of wine out of your bottle  for I am very hungry and thirsty   But the clever son replied   What  give you my cake and my wine  ~newline~ Not I  indeed  so take yourself off   and he left the man standing and went on  ~newline~ The young man began cutting down a tree  but it was not long before he made a false stroke  the axe slipped and cut his arm so badly that he was obliged to go home and have it bound up  ~newline~ Now  this false stroke was caused by the little gray old man  ~newline~ When he reached the wood the very same little old man met him  and after greeting him kindly  said   Give me a little of your cake and a drop from your bottle  for I am very hungry and thirsty    Oh   replied the simple youth   I have only a cake  which has been baked in the ashes  and some sour beer  but you are welcome to a share of it  ~newline~ After they had eaten and drank enough  the little old man said   Because you have been kind hearted  and shared your dinner with me  I will make you in future lucky in all you undertake  ~newline~ There stands an old tree  cut it down  and you will find something good at the root   Then the old man said  Farewell   and left him  ~newline~  Ah   thought the eldest   I shall soon have an opportunity to pluck one of them   and so it happened  for not long after the young man left the room  ~newline~ In the morning the young man came in  took the goose on his arm  and went away without troubling himself about the three girls  who were following close behind him  ~newline~  What are you about  you bold faced hussies  running after a young man in that way through the fields  ~newline~ After this  the youth went to the king  and demanded his daughter in marriage  according to the king s decree  but his majesty did not quite like to have the young man for a son in law  so he said that  before he could consent to the marriage  the youth must bring him a man who could drink all the wine in the king s cellar  ~newline~ The simpleton went into the forest  for he thought   If anyone can help me  it is the little gray man   When he arrived at the spot where he had cut down the tree  there stood a man with a very miserable face  ~newline~ I have emptied a cask of wine already  but it was just like a drop of water on a hot stone    I can help you   cried the young man   come with me  and you shall have your fill  I promise you   Upon this he led the man into the king s cellar  where he opened the casks one after another  and drank and drank till his back ached  and before the day closed he had quite emptied the king s cellar  ~newline~ Again the young man asked for his bride  but the king was annoyed at the thought of giving his daughter to such a common fellow   Created for Lit Go on the web at fcit usf edu       The Golden Goose Grimm and to get rid of him he made another condition  ~newline~ He said that no man should have his daughter who could not find someone able to eat up a whole mountain of bread  ~newline~ Away went the simpleton to the forest as before  and there in the same place sat a man binding himself round tightly with a belt  and making the most horrible faces  ~newline~ The hungry man placed himself before the bread  and began to eat  and before evening the whole pile had disappeared  ~newline~ The youth went at once straight to the forest  and saw the same old gray man to whom he had given his cake

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: After awhile they came to a city in which reigned a king who had a daughter of such a melancholy disposition that no one could make her laugh  therefore he issued a decree that whoever would make the princess laugh should have her in marriage  ~newline~ After this  the youth went to the king  and demanded his daughter in marriage  according to the king s decree  but his majesty did not quite like to have the young man for a son in law  so he said that  before he could consent to the marriage  the youth must bring him a man who could drink all the wine in the king s cellar  ~newline~ I have emptied a cask of wine already  but it was just like a drop of water on a hot stone    I can help you   cried the young man   come with me  and you shall have your fill  I promise you   Upon this he led the man into the king s cellar  where he opened the casks one after another  and drank and drank till his back ached  and before the day closed he had quite emptied the king s cellar  ~newline~ Again the young man asked for his bride  but the king was annoyed at the thought of giving his daughter to such a common fellow   Created for Lit Go on the web at fcit usf edu       The Golden Goose Grimm and to get rid of him he made another condition  ~newline~ Away went the simpleton to the forest as before  and there in the same place sat a man binding himself round tightly with a belt  and making the most horrible faces  ~newline~  Get up   he exclaimed   and come with me  and I will give you plenty to eat  I ll warrant   So he led him to the king s court  where his majesty had ordered all the flour in the kingdom to be made into bread  and piled up in a huge mountain  ~newline~ Then the simpleton went a third time to the king  and asked for his bride  but the king made several excuses  and at last said that if he could bring him a ship that would travel as well by land as by water  then he should  without any further conditions  marry his daughter  ~newline~  Ah   he said  as the youth approached   it was I who sent the men to eat and drink  and I will also give you a ship that can travel by land or by sea  because when you thought I was poor you were kindhearted  and gave me food and drink   The youth took the ship  and when the king saw it he was quite surprised  but he could not any longer refuse to give him his daughter in marriage  ~newline~ The wedding was celebrated with great pomp  and after the king s death the simple wood cutter inherited the whole kingdom  and lived happily with his wife

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: When he reached the wood the very same little old man met him  and after greeting him kindly  said   Give me a little of your cake and a drop from your bottle  for I am very hungry and thirsty    Oh   replied the simple youth   I have only a cake  which has been baked in the ashes  and some sour beer  but you are welcome to a share of it  ~newline~ Let us sit down  and eat and drink together   So they seated themselves  and  lo and behold  when the youth opened his basket  the cake had been turned into a beautiful cake  and the sour beer into wine  ~newline~ The youth set to work  and very soon succeeded in felling the tree  when he found sitting at the roots a goose  whose feathers were of pure gold  ~newline~ Now  when the simple youth heard this  he ran before her  and the whole seven trotted after him  ~newline~ After this  the youth went to the king  and demanded his daughter in marriage  according to the king s decree  but his majesty did not quite like to have the young man for a son in law  so he said that  before he could consent to the marriage  the youth must bring him a man who could drink all the wine in the king s cellar  ~newline~ The youth asked him why he looked so sorrowful  ~newline~ As the youth approached  he cried   I have eaten a whole ovenfull of rolls  but it has not satisfied me a bit  I am as hungry as ever  and my stomach feels so empty that I am obliged to bind it round tightly  or I should die of hunger   The simpleton could hardly contain himself for joy when he heard this  ~newline~ The youth went at once straight to the forest  and saw the same old gray man to whom he had given his cake  ~newline~  Ah   he said  as the youth approached   it was I who sent the men to eat and drink  and I will also give you a ship that can travel by land or by sea  because when you thought I was poor you were kindhearted  and gave me food and drink   The youth took the ship  and when the king saw it he was quite surprised  but he could not any longer refuse to give him his daughter in marriage

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: In a short time after the second sister came in with the full expectation of gaining a golden feather  but as she touched her sister to move her from the bird  her hand stuck fast to her sister s dress  and neither of them could free herself  ~newline~  Keep away  keep away   screamed the other two   in heaven s name keep away   But she could not imagine why she should keep away  ~newline~ After awhile they came to a city in which reigned a king who had a daughter of such a melancholy disposition that no one could make her laugh  therefore he issued a decree that whoever would make the princess laugh should have her in marriage  ~newline~ After this  the youth went to the king  and demanded his daughter in marriage  according to the king s decree  but his majesty did not title: The Golden Goose
sentence: The youth set to work  and very soon succeeded in felling the tree  when he found sitting at the roots a goose  whose feathers were of pure gold  ~newline~ The landlord had three daughters  who looked at the goose with envious eyes  ~newline~ So she made a spring forward and touched her second sister  and immediately she also was made a prisoner  and in this position they were obliged to remain by the goose all night  ~newline~ In the morning the young man came in  took the goose on his arm  and went away without troubling himself about the three girls  who were following close behind him  ~newline~ Hardly had they touched the clerk when they also stuck fast as the others  and the simpleton with his golden goose travelled with the seven

sentence: Go home  all of you   He placed his hand on the youngest to pull her back  but the moment he touched her he also became fixed  and was obliged to follow and run like the rest  ~newline~ In a moment he found that his hand was fixed  and he also had to run like the rest  ~newline~ After this  the youth went to the king  and demanded his daughter in marriage  according to the king s decree  but his majesty did not quite like to have the young man for a son in law  so he said that  before he could consent to the marriage  the youth must bring him a man who could drink all the wine in the king s cellar  ~newline~ I have emptied a cask of wine already  but it was just like a drop of water on a hot stone    I can help you   cried the young man   come with me  and you shall have your fill  I promise you   Upon this he led the man into the king s cellar  where he opened the casks one after another  and drank and drank till his back ached  and before the day closed he had quite emptied the king s cellar

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: Created for Lit Go on the web at fcit usf edu       The Golden Goose Grimm  Shame on you   he cried out  ~newline~ In a few minutes the clerk met them  and when he saw the parson running after the girls  he wondered greatly  and cried out   Halloa  master parson  where are you running in such haste  ~newline~ I have emptied a cask of wine already  but it was just like a drop of water on a hot stone    I can help you   cried the young man   come with me  and you shall have your fill  I promise you   Upon this he led the man into the king s cellar  where he opened the casks one after another  and drank and drank till his back ached  and before the day closed he had quite emptied the king s cellar  ~newline~ As the youth approached  he cried   I have eaten a whole ovenfull of rolls  but it has not satisfied me a bit  I am as hungry as ever  and my stomach feels so empty that I am obliged to bind it round tightly  or I should die of hunger   The simpleton could hardly contain himself for joy when he heard this

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: Keep away  keep away   screamed the other two   in heaven s name keep away   But she could not imagine why she should keep away

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: In a short time after the second sister came in with the full expectation of gaining a golden feather  but as she touched her sister to move her from the bird  her hand stuck fast to her sister s dress  and neither of them could free herself  ~newline~ So she made a spring forward and touched her second sister  and immediately she also was made a prisoner  and in this position they were obliged to remain by the goose all night  ~newline~ Go home  all of you   He placed his hand on the youngest to pull her back  but the moment he touched her he also became fixed  and was obliged to follow and run like the rest  ~newline~ Hardly had they touched the clerk when they also stuck fast as the others  and the simpleton with his golden goose travelled with the seven

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: They had never seen such a wonderful bird  and longed to have at least one of its feathers  ~newline~ She instantly went up to the bird and took hold of its wing  but as she did so  the finger and thumb remained and stuck fast  ~newline~ In a short time after the second sister came in with the full expectation of gaining a golden feather  but as she touched her sister to move her from the bird  her hand stuck fast to her sister s dress  and neither of them could free herself  ~newline~ If they were near the golden bird  why should not she be there

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: He took it up  and  instead of going home  carried it with him to an inn at a little distance  where he intended to pass the night  ~newline~ She instantly went up to the bird and took hold of its wing  but as she did so  the finger and thumb remained and stuck fast  ~newline~ In the morning the young man came in  took the goose on his arm  and went away without troubling himself about the three girls  who were following close behind him  ~newline~  Ah   he said  as the youth approached   it was I who sent the men to eat and drink  and I will also give you a ship that can travel by land or by sea  because when you thought I was poor you were kindhearted  and gave me food and drink   The youth took the ship  and when the king saw it he was quite surprised  but he could not any longer refuse to give him his daughter in marriage

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: Let us sit down  and eat and drink together   So they seated themselves  and  lo and behold  when the youth opened his basket  the cake had been turned into a beautiful cake  and the sour beer into wine  ~newline~ After this  the youth went to the king  and demanded his daughter in marriage  according to the king s decree  but his majesty did not quite like to have the young man for a son in law  so he said that  before he could consent to the marriage  the youth must bring him a man who could drink all the wine in the king s cellar  ~newline~  Ah   he said  as the youth approached   it was I who sent the men to eat and drink  and I will also give you a ship that can travel by land or by sea  because when you thought I was poor you were kindhearted  and gave me food and drink   The youth took the ship  and when the king saw it he was quite surprised  but he could not any longer refuse to give him his daughter in marriage

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: The Golden Goose by Grimm Created for Lit Go on the web at fcit usf edu       The Golden Goose Grimm His mother  however  gave him a cake which had been made with water and baked in the ashes  and a bottle of sour beer  ~newline~  Oh   he exclaimed   I suffer such dreadful thirst that nothing seems able to quench it  and cold water I cannot endure  ~newline~ I have emptied a cask of wine already  but it was just like a drop of water on a hot stone    I can help you   cried the young man   come with me  and you shall have your fill  I promise you   Upon this he led the man into the king s cellar  where he opened the casks one after another  and drank and drank till his back ached  and before the day closed he had quite emptied the king s cellar  ~newline~ Then the simpleton went a third time to the king  and asked for his bride  but the king made several excuses  and at last said that if he could bring him a ship that would travel as well by land as by water  then he should  without any further conditions  marry his daughter

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: As he entered the forest he met a gray old man  who bade him  Good morning   and said   Give me a little piece of cake out of your basket and a drop of wine out of your bottle  for I am very hungry and thirsty   But the clever son replied   What  give you my cake and my wine  ~newline~ When he reached the wood the very same little old man met him  and after greeting him kindly  said   Give me a little of your cake and a drop from your bottle  for I am very hungry and thirsty    Oh   replied the simple youth   I have only a cake  which has been baked in the ashes  and some sour beer  but you are welcome to a share of it  ~newline~ As the youth approached  he cried   I have eaten a whole ovenfull of rolls  but it has not satisfied me a bit  I am as hungry as ever  and my stomach feels so empty that I am obliged to bind it round tightly  or I should die of hunger   The simpleton could hardly contain himself for joy when he heard this  ~newline~ The hungry man placed himself before the bread  and began to eat  and before evening the whole pile had disappeared

title: The Golden Goose
sentence: As he entered the forest he met a gray old man  who bade him  Good morning   and said   Give me a little piece of cake out of your basket and a drop of wine out of your bottle  for I am very hungry and thirsty   But the clever son replied   What  give you my cake and my wine  ~newline~ Now  this false stroke was caused by the little gray old man  ~newline~ The simpleton went into the forest  for he thought   If anyone can help me  it is the little gray man   When he arrived at the spot where he had cut down the tree  there stood a man with a very miserable face  ~newline~ The youth went at once straight to the forest  and saw the same old gray man to whom he had given his cake
